User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Nipher application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

signupDate.description: The date and time the user signed up.

definition.description: Stores user data. The 'userId' parameter corresponds to the Firebase Authentication UID, ensuring path-based ownership and authorization independence.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user, matching the Firebase Authentication UID.

firestore.reasoning: The data structure is designed to store user information securely and efficiently. It prioritizes authorization independence by leveraging path-based ownership. The structure ensures that access control is straightforward and doesn't rely on complex hierarchical `get()` calls, which improves security and simplifies debugging. The segregation of user data into individual user documents provides a homogeneous security posture for each user's information. This design facilitates secure `list` operations, as access is determined by the path structure.
